modules.description: Provides functions to define and combine infix, prefix, and postfix operators with specified precedence and associativity, along with a concatenation operation for merging operator sets. Works with the type ('a, 'b) t to represent operator configurations. Used to parse expressions like x = y, ¬ x, and x ! by specifying operator behavior during parsing.

Transforms strings containing symbols and mixfix operators into structured binary trees, supporting dynamic adjustment of parsing rules. Operates on strings and operator precedence/associativity configurations to build hierarchical representations. Useful for parsing complex term-based languages like arithmetic expressions or lambda calculus.

Constructs and combines infix, prefix, and postfix operators with defined precedence and associativity, using the type ('a, 'b) t to represent operator configurations. Supports parsing expressions such as x = y, ¬ x, and x ! by specifying how to handle operator behavior and token conversion. Provides a concatenation function to merge operator sets, enabling complex expression structures. Allows custom parsing rules for non-operator tokens and defines how to combine parsed results into binary trees.
